sub_topic: Determine the Lie derivative of a vector field on a manifold.
message_1: Let M be a smooth manifold and let V be a vector field defined on M. Suppose that V is given by V(x,y,z) = (x^2 + 2xy) d/dx + (y^2 + yz) d/dy + 3xz d/dz. Determine the Lie derivative of V with respect to the vector field W(x,y,z) = (xy + 2z) d/dx + (x + z) d/dy + y d/dz, evaluated at the point (1,1,1).
message_2:
To compute the Lie derivative of V with respect to W, we use the Lie bracket [W, V]. The Lie bracket is defined as [W, V] = (W(V) - V(W)), where W(V) and V(W) are the action of the vector fields W and V on each other.

First, we compute W(V):

W(V) = (xy + 2z) d(V)/dx + (x + z) d(V)/dy + y d(V)/dz

W(V) = (xy + 2z) d((x^2 + 2xy) d/dx + (y^2 + yz) d/dy + 3xz d/dz)/dx + (x + z) d((x^2 + 2xy) d/dx + (y^2 + yz) d/dy + 3xz d/dz)/dy + y d((x^2 + 2xy) d/dx + (y^2 + yz) d/dy + 3xz d/dz)/dz

W(V) = (xy + 2z) (2x + 2y) d/dx + (x + z) (2y + z) d/dy + y (3x) d/dz

Now, we compute V(W):

V(W) = (x^2 + 2xy) d(W)/dx + (y^2 + yz) d(W)/dy + 3xz d(W)/dz

V(W) = (x^2 + 2xy) d((xy + 2z) d/dx + (x + z) d/dy + y d/dz)/dx + (y^2 + yz) d((xy + 2z) d/dx + (x + z) d/dy + y d/dz)/dy + 3xz d((xy + 2z) d/dx + (x + z) d/dy + y d/dz)/dz

V(W) = (x^2 + 2xy) (y) d/dx + (y^2 + yz) (x) d/dy + 3xz (1) d/dz

Now, we compute the Lie bracket [W, V] = W(V) - V(W):

[W, V] = ((xy + 2z) (2x + 2y) - (x^2 + 2xy) (y)) d/dx + ((x + z) (2y + z) - (y^2 + yz) (x)) d/dy + (y (3x) - 3xz (1)) d/dz

Finally, we evaluate [W, V] at the point (1,1,1):

[W, V](1,1,1) = ((1 + 2) (2 + 2) - (1 + 2) (1)) d/dx + ((1 + 1) (2 + 1) - (1 + 1) (1)) d/dy + (1 (3) - 3(1)) d/dz

[W, V](1,1,1) = (6 - 3) d/dx + (4 - 2) d/dy + (3 - 3) d/dz

[W, V](1,1,1) = 3 d/dx + 2 d/dy

So, the Lie derivative of V with respect to W evaluated at the point (1,1,1) is 3 d/dx + 2 d/dy.
